snippet: For Blackhawks left wing Artemi Panarin, a Russian, the language of hockey takes over at the rink, and he has responded by becoming one of the top first-year players in the N.H.L.
abstract: Artemi Panarin, rookie Russian left wing for Chicago Blackhawks, has difficulty communicating with English-language media, but it has not affected his play as he emerges as top candidate for annual Calder Memorial Trophy; has also been learning from his teammate, league's top scorer Patrick Kane, with whom he has bonded with on and off ice.
lead_paragraph: For Blackhawks left wing Artemi Panarin, a Russian, the language of hockey takes over at the rink, and he has responded by becoming one of the top first-year players in the N.H.L.

headline.main: Rookie’s English Needs Work, but His Game Is Thriving
headline.print_headline: Rookie’s English Needs Work, but His Game Is Thriving
